meanings.definition: To refuse to do something or go somewhere
meanings.sent1: Tom kept jibbing when asked to clean his room.
meanings.sent2: The child was jibbing about eating his vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The cat was jibbing about taking a bath, meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was jibbing the idea of waking up early for the hike.
meanings.sent5: The student was jibbing the idea of doing homework, procrastinating instead.

meanings.definition: To change direction suddenly while skiing or snowboarding
meanings.sent1: The skier was jibbing to avoid a tree on the slope.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed jibbing down the mountain with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The penguin was jibbing on the ice, sliding in different directions.
meanings.sent4: The car jibbed around the corner, narrowly missing a collision.
meanings.sent5: He was jibbing through the snow, leaving a trail of twists and turns.

meanings.definition: To make a joke or witty remark
meanings.sent1: She was always jibbing during class to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent2: The comedian started jibbing about everyday life situations.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was jibbing in its cage, mimicking funny sounds.
meanings.sent4: His mind was jibbing with clever comebacks for the debate.
meanings.sent5: The friends were jibbing back and forth, laughing at each other's jokes.
